org.fosstrak.reader.rprm.core.msg
Class NotificationChannelConnections

java.lang.Object
  org.fosstrak.reader.rprm.core.msg.NotificationChannelConnections

public class NotificationChannelConnections
extends java.lang.Object

This class is used as a pool for notification channel connections. Every NotificationChannel needs a connection to send the read reports to the host. This class manages the Connection used for that purpose. Connections are either persistent or non-persistent, which means that they are destroied after the ReadReport is sent to the host system.

Author:
Andreas Fürer, ETH Zurich Switzerland, Winter 2005/06

Method Detail

getInstance

public static NotificationChannelConnections getInstance()
Returns the single Instance of a NotificationChannels.

Returns:
The single instance of NotificationChannels.

create

public void create(java.lang.String name,
                   Address address,
                   SenderHandshakeMessage senderHandshake,
                   ReceiverHandshakeMessage receiverHandshake)
Create a new notification channel and add it to the NotificationChannels. Also a new Connection using the format message format for serializing the messages is instantiated.

Parameters:
name - The name of the notification channel
address - The address of the host to send the notifications.
senderHandshake - The handshake of the request.
receiverHandshake - The handshake of the response

close

public void close(Connection conn)
Closes a notification channel and removes it from the Clients.

Parameters:
conn - The connection used to send the notifications.

getChannelFormat

public MessageFormat getChannelFormat(java.lang.String name)
Gets the message format of a notification channel.

Parameters:
name - The name of the notification channel.
Returns:
The MessageFormat to use as the format for serializing the message.

nextMessageId

public static int nextMessageId()
Gets the the ID which are used in the message to identify a specific message (e.g., in the ACK process). The id is automatically increased.

Returns:
the next id to use as a message id.

reset

public void reset()
Resets all NotificationChannelConnections.
